previous_headings: rglobi vignette - an R interface to the aggregated biotic interaction data of GloBI (https://www.globalbioticinteractions.org)
text: rglobi allows easy access GLoBI database wrapping existing API.

previous_headings: rglobi vignette - an R interface to the aggregated biotic interaction data of GloBI (https://www.globalbioticinteractions.org) > Quick start
text: Note since rglobi still pretty new, dev version library available time. hope publish version CRAN library matures. information see GitHub.
code: install.packages("devtools") ##  ## The downloaded binary packages are in ##  /var/folders/v4/0_y78_xj1x7b72l89cwc2kq80000gp/T//RtmpF6qc1T/downloaded_packages devtools::install_github("ropensci/rglobi") ## Downloading github repo ropensci/rglobi@master ## Installing rglobi ## '/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Resources/bin/R' --vanilla CMD INSTALL  \ ##   '/private/var/folders/v4/0_y78_xj1x7b72l89cwc2kq80000gp/T/RtmpF6qc1T/devtools15b730380a08/ropensci-rglobi-0b49250'  \ ##   --library='/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.1/Resources/library'  \ ##   --install-tests  ##  ## Reloading installed rglobi library("rglobi")

previous_headings: rglobi vignette - an R interface to the aggregated biotic interaction data of GloBI (https://www.globalbioticinteractions.org) > Quick start
what: Find interactions involving a certain species
text: Determining species interact () major focus ecology. Global Biotic Interactions Database offers data multiple interaction types, rglobi library offers several ways specify access interactions. get_interactions() primary function used data specific interaction type required. focus taxon entered (may specified “Genus species” higher level (e.g., Genus, Family, Class)). get_predators_of() get_prey_of() wrappers get_interactions() remove need specify interaction type complete list supported interaction types, data sources type interactions specified, interaction labeled “interacts_with”. wish view interactions instead specific types (e.g., parasitism predation instead just one two), get_interactions_by_taxa() function allows . addition, function provides options search interactions two groups (source target taxa, see table) find interactions certain region. source taxa need identified, can also specify target taxon /geographic boundary (Coordinates must decimal degrees (EPSG:4326) correspond west, south, east, northern boundaries (.e., min x, min y, max x, max y).
code: hsapiens <- get_interactions(taxon = "Homo sapiens", interaction.type = "preysOn") head(hsapiens) ##   source_taxon_external_id source_taxon_name ## 1               EOL:327955      Homo sapiens ## 2               EOL:327955      Homo sapiens ## 3               EOL:327955      Homo sapiens ## 4               EOL:327955      Homo sapiens ## 5               EOL:327955      Homo sapiens ## 6               EOL:327955      Homo sapiens ## previous_headings: rglobi vignette - an R interface to the aggregated biotic interaction data of GloBI (https://www.globalbioticinteractions.org) > Quick start
what: Find interactions in a geographic areas
text: Instead taxon-specific approach, users may also wish gather information interactions occuring specific area. example, group developing ecoystem models Gulf Mexico may want consider data region. rglobi enables type search allowing users specify rectangular bounding box. Coordinates must decimal degrees (EPSG:4326) correspond west, south, east, northern boundaries (.e., min x, min y, max x, max y). see locations interactions entered GloBi, can also restrict search certain area:
code: gulfinteractions <- get_interactions_in_area( bbox=c(-97.0, 17.5, -81, 31)) head(gulfinteractions) ##   source_taxon_external_id        source_taxon_name ## 1                    EOL:1                 Animalia ## 2                 EOL:1905           Actinopterygii ## 3              EOL:2598871                Crustacea ## 4               EOL:208553 Chloroscombrus chrysurus ## 5               EOL:208553 Chloroscombrus chrysurus ## 6               EOL:208553 Chloroscombrus chrysurus ##                                                                                             source_taxon_path ## 1                                                                                                    Animalia ## 2                          Biota | Animalia | Chordata | Vertebrata | Gnathostomata | Pisces | Actinopterygii ## 3                                     Animalia | Bilateria | Protostomia | Ecdysozoa | Arthropoda | Crustacea ## 4 Animalia | Chordata | Actinopterygii | Perciformes | Carangidae | Chloroscombrus | Chloroscombrus chrysurus ## 5 Animalia | Chordata | Actinopterygii | Perciformes | Carangidae | Chloroscombrus | Chloroscombrus chrysurus ## 6 Animalia | Chordata | Actinopterygii | Perciformes | Carangidae | Chloroscombrus | Chloroscombrus chrysurus ##   source_specimen_life_stage interaction_type target_taxon_external_id ## 1                         NA     preyedUponBy               EOL:208553 ## 5                         NA          preysOn                 EOL:1905 ## 6                         NA          preysOn              EOL:2598871 ##          target_taxon_name ## 1 Chloroscombrus chrysurus ## 2 Chloroscombrus chrysurus ## 3 Chloroscombrus chrysurus ## 4                 Animalia ## 5           Actinopterygii ## 6                Crustacea ##                                                                                             target_taxon_path ## 1 Animalia | Chordata | Actinopterygii | Perciformes | Carangidae | Chloroscombrus | Chloroscombrus chrysurus ## 2 Animalia | Chordata | Actinopterygii | Perciformes | Carangidae | Chloroscombrus | Chloroscombrus chrysurus ## title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Poelen J, Gosnell S, Slyusarev S, Waters H (2023). rglobi: R Interface Global Biotic Interactions. https://docs.ropensci.org/rglobi/, https://github.com/ropensci/rglobi.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rglobi: R Interface to Global Biotic Interactions},   author = {Jorrit Poelen and Stephen Gosnell and Sergey Slyusarev and Helen Waters},   year = {2023},   note = {https://docs.ropensci.org/rglobi/, https://github.com/ropensci/rglobi}, }

what: R Interface to Global Biotic Interactions
title: R Interface to Global Biotic Interactions
text: R library access species interaction data http://globalbioticinteractions.org

title: R Interface to Global Biotic Interactions
text: install rglobi CRAN: install development version:

title: R Interface to Global Biotic Interactions
text: Please see R help pages (e.g. ?get_interactions_by_taxa vignettes information.
code: library(rglobi) # find all unique prey names of Homo sapiens prey_of("Homo sapiens")$target_taxon_name # is a shortcut of get_interactions_by_taxa(sourcetaxon='Homo sapiens', interactiontype='preysOn')$target_taxon_name  # list of supported interactions types get_interaction_types()  # all known prey names and locations (latitude, longitude) where birds (Aves) preyed on rodents (Rodentia) in California obs <- get_interactions_by_taxa(sourcetaxon = "Aves", bbox=c(-125.53344800000002,32.750323,-114.74487299999998,41.574361), targettaxon = "Rodentia", returnobservations=T) locations <- cbind(obs$target_taxon_name, obs$latitude, obs$longitude)

title: R Interface to Global Biotic Interactions
text: Tests can executed using devtools package. reload library, executes test_that testcases show test reports.
code: # workdir should be rglobi repo root directory (check with getwd()) # install dependencies  devtools::install('.') devtools::test()

what: Get Interaction Matrix. Constructs an interaction matrix indicating whether source taxa (rows) or target taxa (columns) are known to interact with given type. — get_interaction_matrix
title: Get Interaction Matrix. Constructs an interaction matrix indicating whether source taxa (rows) or target taxa (columns) are known to interact with given type. — get_interaction_matrix
text: Get Interaction Matrix. Constructs interaction matrix indicating whether source taxa (rows) target taxa (columns) known interact given type.

title: Get Interaction Matrix. Constructs an interaction matrix indicating whether source taxa (rows) or target taxa (columns) are known to interact with given type. — get_interaction_matrix
code: get_interaction_matrix(   source.taxon.names = list("Homo sapiens"),   target.taxon.names = list("Mammalia"),   interaction.type = "eats",   opts = list(),   read_csv = read_csv_online )

title: Get Interaction Matrix. Constructs an interaction matrix indicating whether source taxa (rows) or target taxa (columns) are known to interact with given type. — get_interaction_matrix
text: source.taxon.names list source taxon names (e.g. list('Mammalia', 'Aves', 'Ariopsis felis')) target.taxon.names list target taxon names interaction.type preferred interaction type (e.g. preysOn) opts list options configure GloBI API read_csv function used find csv associated query url, defaulting online query method

title: Get Interaction Matrix. Constructs an interaction matrix indicating whether source taxa (rows) or target taxa (columns) are known to interact with given type. — get_interaction_matrix
text: matrix representing species interactions source target taxa

title: Get Species Interaction from GloBI — get_interactions
Get Species Interaction from GloBI — get_interactions
text: taxon canonical scientific name source taxon (e.g. Homo sapiens) interaction.type preferred interaction type (e.g. preysOn) ... list options configure GloBI API

title: Get Species Interaction from GloBI — get_interactions
text: species interactions source target taxa

title: Get Species Interaction from GloBI — get_interactions

what: Return interactions involving specific taxa — get_interactions_by_taxa
title: Return interactions involving specific taxa — get_interactions_by_taxa
text: Returns interactions involving specific taxa.  Secondary (target) taxa spatial boundaries may also set

title: Return interactions involving specific taxa — get_interactions_by_taxa
code: get_interactions_by_taxa(   sourcetaxon,   targettaxon = NULL,   interactiontype = NULL,   accordingto = NULL,   showfield = c("source_taxon_external_id", "source_taxon_name", "source_taxon_path",     "source_specimen_life_stage", "interaction_type", "target_taxon_external_id",     "target_taxon_name", "target_taxon_path", "target_specimen_life_stage", "latitude",     "longitude", "study_citation", "study_external_id", "study_source_citation"),   otherkeys = NULL,   bbox = NULL,   returnobservations = F,   opts = list(),   read_csv = read_csv_online )

title: Return interactions involving specific taxa — get_interactions_by_taxa
text: sourcetaxon Taxa interest (consumer, predator, parasite); may specified "Genus species" higher level (e.g., Genus, Family, Class). targettaxon Taxa interest (prey, host); may specified "Genus species" higher level (e.g., Genus, Family, Class) interactiontype Interaction types interest (prey, host); may specified listed get_interaction_types() accordingto Data source interest showfield Data fields interest (e. g. source_taxon_external_id, source_taxon_name); may specified listed get_data_fields() otherkeys list key-value pairs query field covered parameters; keys may specified listed get_data_fields() bbox Coordinates EPSG:4326 decimal degrees defining "left, bottom, right, top" bounding box returnobservations true, individual observations returned, else distinct relationships opts list named options configure GloBI API read_csv function used find csv associated query url, defaulting online query method

title: Return interactions involving specific taxa — get_interactions_by_taxa
text: Returns data frame interactions

title: Return interactions involving specific taxa — get_interactions_by_taxa
text: data sources type interactions specified, interaction labeled "interacts_with"

title: Return interactions involving specific taxa — get_interactions_by_taxa
code: if (FALSE) { get_interactions_by_taxa(sourcetaxon = "Rattus") get_interactions_by_taxa(sourcetaxon = "Aves", targettaxon = "Rattus") get_interactions_by_taxa(sourcetaxon = "Rattus rattus", bbox = c(-67.87,12.79,-57.08,23.32)) }

rglobi 0.3.3
text: Change http://ropensci.org/packages https://reopensci.org/packages/ address “note” due 403 forbidden 301 redirect.

title: rglobi 0.3.2
text: Change https://globalbioticinteractions.org https://www.globalbioticinteractions.org address “note” due 301 redirect.

title: rglobi 0.3.1
text: Remove travis-ci badge README.md caused “note” due 301 redirect. Remove references Cypher query support vignettes.

title: rglobi 0.3.0
text: Removing support directly executing Cypher queries: cypher queries open ended, caused intermittent test errors, subject change future neo4j upgrades.

title: rglobi 0.2.28
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-25 Adding warning message query generates results can returned. Big thanks Helen Waters contributions @H-Waters https://github.com/H-Waters via https://github.com/ropensci/# rglobi/pull/45 update NEWS format

title: rglobi 0.2.27
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-18 improve test cases skip message web apis unavailable

title: rglobi 0.2.26
text: improve test cases include error handling

title: rglobi 0.2.25
text: CRAN release: 2021-08-12 added section returnobservations=T getting started vignette suggested @ZekeMarshall https://github.com/ropensci/# rglobi/issues/38#issuecomment-897603331 .

title: rglobi 0.2.24
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-19 replace broken url http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/wgs-84/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System .

title: rglobi 0.2.23
text: minor changes @jimhester (thanks Jim!) prepare readr 2.0.0 release via https://github.com/ropensci/# rglobi/pull/37 .

title: rglobi 0.2.22
text: CRAN release: 2021-04-17 include markdown DESCRIPTION suggests list instructed https://github.com/yihui/knitr/issues/1864 update urls suggested cran release checks exclude .github workflow directory R build

title: rglobi 0.2.21
text: CRAN release: 2019-12-07 use query cache unit tests make tests less dependent state online api

title: rglobi 0.2.20
text: CRAN release: 2019-09-20 Use readr package handle incoming csv streams help avoid encoding issues Windows . Also see https://github.com/ropensci/# rglobi/issues/33 . remove debug messages updates reference https://github.com/globalbioticinteractions/globalbioticinteractions repo migration https://github.com/jhpoelen/eol-globi-data .

title: rglobi 0.2.19
text: CRAN release: 2019-04-26 show informative messages like GloBI data services available [api.globalbioticinteractions.org]. connected internet? internet resources available. Suggested Brian D. Ripley . Also see https://github.com/ropensci/# rglobi/issues/31 .

title: rglobi 0.2.18
text: CRAN release: 2019-03-28 Update cypher query endpoint server upgrade neo4j v2.3.12

title: rglobi 0.2.17
text: CRAN release: 2018-12-14 Use utils::download.file attempt avoid intermittent download issues debian.

title: rglobi 0.2.16
text: Enforce utf-8 encoding reading csv, take 2.

title: rglobi 0.2.15
text: Enforce utf-8 encoding reading csv.

text: CRAN release: 2018-03-23 Fix yet another test error caused overly restrictive assertion.

title: rglobi 0.2.12
text: CRAN release: 2018-02-13 Fix test error caused overly restrictive assertion.

title: rglobi 0.2.11
text: CRAN release: 2017-10-15 switching https endpoint GloBI APIs, default configuration needed updating ensure existing functions continue work.

title: rglobi 0.2.10
text: CRAN release: 2017-09-19 rglobi user requested search interactions type (see https://github.com/ropensci/# rglobi/issues/23). functionality implemented adding method get_interactions_by_type. rglobi user requested search interactions type (see https://github.com/ropensci/# rglobi/issues/23). functionality implemented adding method get_interactions_by_type.

title: rglobi 0.2.9
text: CRAN release: 2016-03-09 make get_interaction_matrix use name matching method get_interactions . See https://github.com/globalbioticinteractions/globalbioticinteractions.github.io/issues/63 .

title: rglobi 0.2.8
text: CRAN release: 2015-05-13 Switch neo4j port 7474 80 following changes neo4j endpoint.
